member.name: T:NUnit.Framework.ITestCaseData
member.summary: The ITestCaseData interface is implemented by a class that is able to return complete testcases for use by a parameterized test method. NOTE: This interface is used in both the framework and the core, even though that results in two different types. However, sharing the source code guarantees that the various implementations will be compatible and that the core is able to reflect successfully over the framework implementations of ITestCaseData.

member.name: T:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.IAddin
member.summary: Add-ins are used to extend NUnti. All add-ins must implement the IAddin interface.

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.IAddin.Install(NUnit.Core.Extensibility.IExtensionHost)
member.summary: When called, the add-in installs itself into the host, if possible. Because NUnit uses separate hosts for the client and test domain environments, an add-in may be invited to istall itself more than once. The add-in is responsible for checking which extension points are supported by the host that is passed to it and taking the appropriate action.
member.param: The host in which to install the add-in
member.returns: True if the add-in was installed, otehrwise false

member.summary: Represents a single point of extension for NUnit. Some extension points may accept only a single extension, while others may accept more than one at the same time. This interface enhances IExtensionPoint by allowing specification of a priority order for applying addins.

member.summary: Install an extension at this extension point specifying an integer priority value for the extension.If the extension object does not meet the requirements for this extension point, or if the extension point does not support the requested priority level, an exception is thrown.

member.summary: The ISuiteBuilder interface is exposed by a class that knows how to build a suite from one or more Types.

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.ISuiteBuilder.CanBuildFrom(System.Type)
member.summary: Examine the type and determine if it is suitable for this builder to use in building a TestSuite. Note that returning false will cause the type to be ignored in loading the tests. If it is desired to load the suite but label it as non-runnable, ignored, etc., then this method must return true.
member.param: The type of the fixture to be used
member.returns: True if the type can be used to build a TestSuite

member.summary: Build a TestSuite from type provided.
member.param: The type of the fixture to be used
member.returns: A TestSuite

member.name: T:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.ITestCaseBuilder
member.summary: The ITestCaseBuilder interface is exposed by a class that knows how to build a test case from certain methods.

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.ITestCaseBuilder.CanBuildFrom(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Examine the method and determine if it is suitable for this builder to use in building a TestCase. Note that returning false will cause the method to be ignored in loading the tests. If it is desired to load the method but label it as non-runnable, ignored, etc., then this method must return true.
member.param: The test method to examine
member.returns: True is the builder can use this method

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.ITestCaseBuilder.BuildFrom(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Build a TestCase from the provided MethodInfo.
member.param: The method to be used as a test case
member.returns: A TestCase or null

member.name: T:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.ITestCaseBuilder2
member.summary: ITestCaseBuilder2 extends ITestCaseBuilder with methods that include the suite for which the test case is being built. Test case builders not needing the suite can continue to implement ITestCaseBuilder.

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.ITestCaseBuilder2.CanBuildFrom(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,NUnit.Core.Test)
member.summary: Examine the method and determine if it is suitable for this builder to use in building a TestCase to be included in the suite being populated. Note that returning false will cause the method to be ignored in loading the tests. If it is desired to load the method but label it as non-runnable, ignored, etc., then this method must return true.
member.param: The test method to examine
The suite being populated
member.returns: True is the builder can use this method

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.Extensibility.ITestCaseBuilder2.BuildFrom(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,NUnit.Core.Test)
member.summary: Build a TestCase from the provided MethodInfo for inclusion in the suite being constructed.
member.param: The method to be used as a test case
The test suite being populated, or null
member.returns: A TestCase or null

member.summary: The test is not runnable.

member.summary: The test can only be run explicitly. Would normally not appear on a TestResult, since it would change to Executed or Skipped.

member.name: F:NUnit.Core.RunState.Skipped
member.summary: The test has been skipped. This value may appear on a Test when certain attributes are used to skip the test.

member.name: F:NUnit.Core.RunState.Ignored
member.summary: The test has been ignored. May appear on a Test, when the IgnoreAttribute is used. Appears on a TestResult in that case or if the test is dynamically ignored.

member.summary: Returns the best available framework that matches a target framework. If the target framework has a build number specified, then an exact match is needed. Otherwise, the matching framework with the highest build number is used.

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.RuntimeFramework.ToString
member.summary: Overridden to return the short name of the framework

member.name: M:NUnit.Core.RuntimeFramework.Supports(NUnit.Core.RuntimeFramework)
member.summary: Returns true if this framework's supports executing under the requested target framework. The target is supported if 1. The runtime types are the same or either one is RuntimeType.Any 2. All specified (non-negative) components of the CLR version are equal. 3. The major and minor components of the current framework version are greater than or equal to the corresponding target components. The last provision allows tests requiring .NET 2.0 to run under the 3.0 and 3.5 platforms and those requiring .NET 4.0 to run under 4.5.
member.param: The RuntimeFramework to be matched.
member.returns: True on match, otherwise false

member.name: T:NUnit.Core.TestID
member.summary: TestID encapsulates a unique identifier for tests. As currently implemented, this is an integer and is unique within the AppDomain. TestID is one component of a TestName. We use this object, rather than a raw int, for two reasons: (1) to hide the implementation so it may be changed later if necessary and (2) so that the id may be null in a "weak" TestName.

member.summary: The int key that distinguishes this test from all others created by the same runner.

member.name: T:NUnit.Core.TestInfo
member.summary: TestInfo holds common info about a test. It represents only a single test or a suite and contains no references to other tests. Since it is informational only, it can easily be passed around using .Net remoting. TestInfo is used directly in all EventListener events and in TestResults. It contains an ID, which can be used by a runner to locate the actual test. TestInfo also serves as the base class for TestNode, which adds hierarchical information and is used in client code to maintain a visible image of the structure of the tests.

member.summary: TestName encapsulates all info needed to identify and locate a test that has been loaded by a runner. It consists of a three components: the simple name of the test, an int id that is unique to a given tree of tests and an int runner id that identifies the particular runner that holds the test instance.

member.name: T:NUnit.Core.TestNode
member.summary: TestNode represents a single test or suite in the test hierarchy. TestNode holds common info needed about a test and represents a single node - either a test or a suite - in the hierarchy of tests. TestNode extends TestInfo, which holds all the information with the exception of the list of child classes. When constructed from a Test, TestNodes are always fully populated with child TestNodes. Like TestInfo, TestNode is purely a data class, and is not able to execute tests.

member.name: T:NUnit.Core.TestRunner
member.summary: The TestRunner Interface allows client code, such as the NUnit console and gui runners, to load and run tests. This is the lowest level interface generally supported for running tests and is implemented by the RemoteTestRunner class in the NUnit core as well as by other classes running on the client side. The Load method is used to load a suite of tests from one or more assemblies, returning a tree of TestNodes to the caller. The CountTestCases family of methods returns the number of test cases in the loaded suite, either in its entirety or by using a filter to count a subset of tests. The Run family of methods performs a test run synchronously, returning a TestResult or TestResult[] to the caller. If provided, an EventListener interface will be notified of significant events in the running of the tests. A filter may be used to run a subset of the tests. BeginRun and EndRun provide a simplified form of the asynchronous invocation pattern used in many places within the .NET framework. Because the current implementation allows only one run to be in process at a time, an IAsyncResult is not used at this time. Methods to cancel a run and to wait for a run to complete are also provided. The result of the last run may be obtained by querying the TestResult property.

member.name: P:NUnit.Core.TestRunner.ID
member.summary: TestRunners are identified by an ID. So long as there is only one test runner or a single chain of test runners, the default id of 0 may be used. However, any client that creates multiple runners must ensure that each one has a unique ID in order to locate and run specific tests.

member.name: P:NUnit.Core.TestRunner.Running
member.summary: Running indicates whether a test is in progress. To retrieve the results from an asynchronous test run, wait till Running is false.

member.name: P:NUnit.Core.TestRunner.TestResult

If true, trace output is returned as a TestOutput event
